resources.string: Now move app and click again to drop \n(Press RETURN to CANCEL)
Now move app and click to drop \n(Press RETURN to CANCEL)
Enable background observation of home-button and startup-event.
App that is started on FireTV startup
App that is started on home button single click.
App that is started on home button double click.
Show also system apps in app list.
Apps that shall not be shown in apps list.
Define the time in milliseconds (between 100 - 1000) to wait for the second click
Hit check for update to check for latest version.
Auto select the first icon when switching to the app drawer (All Apps).

AppStarter is a Non-Root Launcher Replacement / App-Drawer for Amazon FireTV:

Visit discussion on XDA-Developers:
http://forum.xda-developers.com/fire-tv/themes-apps/app-root-home-launcher-replacement-app-t3118135

AppStarter is Open-Source, visit project on GitHub:
https://github.com/sphinx02/AppStarter
The time window in milliseconds (between 0 - 10000) in which AppStarter prevents the amazon home launcher from coming to foreground when click-actions have been performed. Set to 0 to disable.
You have already the newest version!
Set a custom background image / wallpaper for AppStarter
Time of inactivity in minutes after which the device goes to sleep.
ATTENTION: This feature has been removed from AppStarter! Long press home-button to find the option to go to sleep immediately.
ATTENTION: If you click here, the device reboots immediately!
Please wait, device goes to sleep in a few seconds..
Only values between %1$d and %2$d minutes are allowed!
Size between 0 and 200 (in DPI) of the App-Icons on the main App-Drawer in DPI. Set to 0 for default.
Export current AppStarter settings to ZIP-File.
Import AppStarter Settings from ZIP-File. Be sure to only import trusted ZIP-Files!
If this option is set, all previous instances of the app are cleared and the app is started fresh (nothing from the last activity is restored).
Single Click App: Clear previous instances
Double Click App: Clear previous instances
Use ADB to detect home button clicks. This is more accurate but does only work with ADB running and correctly enabled (disable / enable in settings).
ATTENTION: This feature has been removed from AppStarter hold \"Enter/Select\"-Button + \"Play\"-Button to restart FireTV.
This is a shortcut to open the ADB settings.

You have choosen the home button observation via ADB.

For this option it is important, that ADB is enabled. If you are already on FireOS5 (Android v5.1), you have to make sure that no other device is connecting via ADB in parallel. If you want to use tools like adbFire, Amazon FireTV Utility App, Apps2Fire or similar, you should disable the ADB observation of AppStarter and disable/enable ADB before you try to connect.

If you want to use ADB observation of AppStarter again, make sure you disable/enable ADB before using it (Shortcut to ADB settings is below this Setting).

You have choosen the new home button observation without ADB.

This observation of the home-button works only if you are on the original Amazon FireTV Home screen. This means if you are in any other App like Kodi, you have to click the home button once to get to the Amazon FireTV Home screen and then you can single or double click the home-button to perform the action desired.

In practice that means, you can also add one home button click if you are in another app. If you are for example in Kodi, you can do a double-click to the home-button to perform the single click operation and according to this you can do a triple click to perform the double click action.

Sorry for this strange behaviour but due to technical limitations of Android, there is no other possibility without ADB at the moment.
If this option is set and the ADB observation fails for three times, the home button observation is automatically changed to Non-ADB observation.

Change to non-ADB Observation\n\nThe observation with ADB failed more than 3 times. The home-button observation have been automatically changed to non-ADB observation. You can change this behaviour in the AppStarter settings.
Hide left bar in app drawer
Left selection bar is hidden when on the main page (App Drawer)
Shows a background for app names in the app drawer. This helps to read app names, if a wallpaper is used.
This feature is only available in FireOS 3 and older..

Decide which Kodi updates you want to install. If you choose \"Nightly\", the check for newer version gets useless (install of current version is then always possible).\nATTENTION: To downgrade you always have to uninstall Kodi manually first!
